laboratory_examinations.findings: Echogenic portal triads throughout the liver suggestive of periportal edema. Gallbladder wall is thickened and edematous. Gallbladder is distended and contains several small gallstones. Common bile duct measures 2 mm. Spleen measures 9.6 cm and is unremarkable. Pancreas is unremarkable without focal lesions. Portal vein is patent with normal hepatopedal flow. No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary duct dilation.
